abstract: The women’s network has named a new president, Allyson McDonald, an announcement that seems to suggest that 85 Broads may develop a way to invest capital in enterprises owned or led by women.
snippet: The women’s network has named a new president, Allyson McDonald, an announcement that seems to suggest that 85 Broads may develop a way to invest capital in enterprises owned or led by women.
lead_paragraph: Sallie L. Krawcheck, a former big bank executive, has emerged as a prominent advocate for Wall Street women in recent weeks, after buying the women’s network 85 Broads in May. But it remained unclear what Ms. Krawcheck was planning to do with the organization.
